misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that Scanner.next() will capture a complete conceptual unit of input, such as a student's full name, even if that name contains a space.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: In the Java Scanner notional machine, next() is delimited by whitespace. If a user enters 'Alice Smith', the machine treats 'Alice' as the first name and 'Smith' as the second name. This causes the code to desynchronize the parallel arrays, as 'Smith' will be stored in the next name slot and eventually cause an InputMismatchException when the program expects an integer score.

misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that the number of students (n) will always be at least 1, and therefore the index n - 1 will always reference a valid, existing element in the array.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: The student fails to account for the empty set (n=0). In Java's execution model, an array of size 0 has no valid indices. Attempting to access index n - 1 (which would be -1) results in a runtime crash.
